Package board

Class GameMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • board.GameMap
  • public class GameMap
extends java.lang.Object
    The logical container of all elements of the map, room, tile, pawns, munition cards and grabbable weapons cards

    • Method Summary

      • gameMapFactory

        public static GameMap gameMapFactory​(GameMode gameMode,
                                     java.lang.String path,
                                     int numOfPlayer,
                                     Tuple3<Deck<Weapon>,​Deck<AmmoCard>,​Deck<PowerUp>> cards)
        Constructor of the GameMap object
        Parameters:
        path - path of the map file
        numOfPlayer - the number of player that join the game
        cards - a Tuple containing the Decks: deck of Weapon, deck of Ammo and deck of PowerUp
        Returns:
        the GameMap object

        public Tile getTile​(TileUID tileID)
        Returns the Tile Object given a TileUID
        Parameters:
        tileID - TileUID of the wanted Tile
        Returns:
        the Tile corresponding to the TileUID
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If no Tile is found, an exception is returned

      • getPosition

        public TileUID getPosition​(Coord coord)
        Returns the TileUID Object given a Coordinate
        Parameters:
        coord - Coordinate of the wanted Tile. Upper left Tile has Coord = (0,0)
        Returns:
        the TileUID corresponding to the Coordinate. If no Tile is found, an empty Optional is returned
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If no Coord is found, an exception is returned

        public java.util.Map<Direction,​TileUID> neighbors​(TileUID tile,
                                                        boolean logical)
        Returns the neighbors of the cell
        Parameters:
        tile - the source tile
        logical - if true don't go through walls, if false do
        Returns:
        A map of neighboring TileUIDs paired with the direction

        Parameters:
        pawn - pawn whose tile is requested
        Returns:
        the tile containing the pawn

      • refill

        public void refill()
        Refill all the Tiles with cards. Spawn point will receive up to 3 Weapon, non-Spawn point will receive an Ammo Card

      • getGrabbable

        public java.util.Set<Grabbable> getGrabbable​(TileUID tile)

      • addGrabbable

        public void addGrabbable​(TileUID tile,
                         Grabbable grabbable)
        Adds a Grabbable elements to the Tile, and checks if the Card is correct
        Parameters:
        tile - the tile where the card must be put
        grabbable - the card

      • pickUpGrabbable

        public Grabbable pickUpGrabbable​(TileUID tile,
                                 Grabbable grabbable)
        Removes the element from the Grabbable set. If there is not this element, throws a NoSuchElementException
        Parameters:
        grabbable - The identifier of the grabbable item
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If this GrabbableUID is not found, an exception is returned

      • pickUpPowerUp

        public PowerUp pickUpPowerUp()
        Removes and returns a PowerUp card picked from the Deck
        Returns:
        A PowerUp card

      • discardPowerUp

        public void discardPowerUp​(PowerUp grabbable)
        Allows the player to discard a PowerUp card. If the Card is not discardable (if it is in the deck or in the stash) an InvalidParameterException is thrown
        Parameters:
        grabbable - the Card to be discarded

      • discardAmmoCard

        public void discardAmmoCard​(AmmoCard grabbable)
        Allows the player to discard an AmmoCard. If the Card is not discardable (if it is in the deck or in the stash) an InvalidParameterException is thrown
        Parameters:
        grabbable - the Card to be discarded

      • discardWeapon

        public void discardWeapon​(TileUID tile,
                          Weapon grabbable)
        Allow the player to discard a Weapon. Needed if the stash is empty
        Parameters:
        tile - the Tile where the weapon must be put
        grabbable - The weapon that has to be discarded

        public java.util.Collection<DamageableUID> getDamageable​(TileUID tile)

        A collections containing the DamageableUID in the tile

        Returns:
        The empty Tile used to store dead pawns

        public boolean emptyWeaponDeck()
        Returns:
        True iif the Deck of weapon is empty
